website_summaries.verdict: Ultrathin but simple design offers good illumination for the non-gamer.
pros: Single-color illumination prevents distractions in a work environment
While the rest isn't padded, the coating feels soft on the wrist

website_summaries.verdict: The keys on the Logitech Illuminated Keyboard are comfortable to use and emit a satisfying click, but it lacks convenient features we've come to expect from a PC keyboard. Nevertheless, we think this Logitech is a practical, affordable, and convenient keyboard that manages to look sexy at the same time.

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard until a button falls off
customer_reviews.text: Bought it twice, both times a button popped off and that was the end of it. Forget trying to fix it. The near microscopic latches break when you try to pop the button back in. Why did they built it so flimsy. Not buying a third one. I'm done with logitech.
customer_reviews.author: R&B

customer_reviews.title: I normally LOVE Logitech's hardware
customer_reviews.text: I normally LOVE Logitech's hardware. I have a logitech keyboard and mouse at home that I love. However, I bought the K740 a few months back for my office and i've had nothing but problems with the keys. As you type, the plastic keys keep popping up off of the keyboard. Finally, one of the keys have broken off and it won't go back on. I wish I could return it and get another one but I do NOT want this model. :(
customer_reviews.author: Tye Pierson

customer_reviews.title: A ploy to sell gaming keyboards, not a gaming keyboard, not even good for fast typers.
customer_reviews.text: Holding down Shift and W, blocks Space from being detected. W - Forward Shift - Run (modifier) Space - Jump Essentially, can't jump when running forward (in my case Star Trek Online, but other games use this combo). Will also prevent fast typing. The keyboard can usually detect key press even if other keys are held down. Insert key is where Print Screen key normally is and Scroll Lock is absent. Non-standard keyboard layout. Spend your money somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Tae H. Song

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard but keys do not hold up
customer_reviews.text: We love the feel of this keyboard and the backlight makes it very easy to work in the dark. The one down side is that the keys break, and when they do, they are impossible to fix. This is our third of these keyboards... they usually last less than a year. Too bad there is no way to fix them - what a waste of materials.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Initially worked great typing easy, quiet, keys nicely back light. Less then 6 months keys presses not consistent pressure and responding having to re-press some keys on edges or with different pressure to get them to respond. Some keys have a crunching feel to them. Save your money, don't buy this product....
customer_reviews.author: jhitz

customer_reviews.title: Intentionally disabled basic gaming (Shift + w + space)
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would've seen happyhubris' review and saved myself the money. I was looking for a small footprint keyboard, and didn't realize they completely disabled the ability to sprint run and jump. Other functions work, but not that specific key combination (shift w space). And I think their right in their theory of why. 50 bucks for a basic keyboard doesn't make their overpriced gaming keyboards worth it so they disable very basic features. 100% done with Logitech because of this. Also within a week the keyboard wrist rest is already in poor condition. Insult to injury.
customer_reviews.author: Not Mary

customer_reviews.title: Keys Break!
customer_reviews.text: Keys snap off easily and customer service does not' respond to emails but every 48 hours and can't seem to look at attachments and miss information provided that they asked for in emails and threaten to close cases due to their inability to use email.
customer_reviews.author: B. York

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: The keys on the left hand side are over lapping the plastic. The left shift key is about to fall off. The fact that Amazon is making ridiculous excuses to filter out negative reviews is also on par with the quality of this product. In short, Amazon is receiving the knock off version of this product. This review is less than 7 days after receiving the product. Save your money and go to office depot to get the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Gorilla Man

customer_reviews.title: It used to be good.
customer_reviews.text: They've apparently discontinued this keyboard. It is a really slim, touch-sensitive keyboard. This was my second keyboard of this type. Unfortunately, the "d" key broke after five months of use on this one. The space bar doesn't work at an angle. You have to really be in the center of it for it to work. I've ordered a newer Logitech mechanical keyboard. Time to go back to the basics.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Six months ago, I was thrilled to purchase this keyboard. I had used an old one previously and liked it so much that I wanted a new one. I see now that the description listed it as refurbished - a surprise to me as I do not like to buy refurbished electronics. So now, six months later, the "a" key is broken. Since I am just a light to regular user (no gaming), I am actually pretty angry that I feel I threw away $55. I will attempt to buy a new clip and reattach the key, via youtube videos, but I should not have to be concerned with that. I would never purchase this keyboard again.
customer_reviews.author: happysnappy

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this model/style for literally years. I type about 8-9 hrs per day and find this brand/model lasts about 2-3 years. I am a huge fan of quiet keys, I hate the click click click of most keyboards. This one does have a quieter click and the keys are soft functioning, meaning I do not have to pound the keys. Light touch is all that is required. I also like that the backlight has different levels of brightness. I hope this model never disappears, I will continue buying it as long as I have computers.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good | Fragile keys
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd time buying this exact keyboard in the past decade. It's one of the few keyboards I've found that offers me all of my desired functionality: *Backlit to relocate finger positioning faster in the dark, when gaming *Soft press/thin keys *Includes convenient volume buttons in the top right *Stable grips on the bottom, so it doesn't slide around Contrary to these pros, this specific model tends to have keys loosen up or fade out rather quickly. Until I find a more durable keyboard with similar pros, this will probably remain my go-to model.
customer_reviews.author: Grelf

customer_reviews.title: Everything was working fine and none of the buttons faded or lost color
customer_reviews.text: I had the same keyboard before for years. Never had any issue. Everything was working fine and none of the buttons faded or lost color. Unfortunately 1 key broke so i ordered the same keyboard again. Everything looks fine yet some of the buttons hardly registers when i press them . They don't feel weird or stiff they just need to be pressed harder or won't register. Space bar it the most annoying because i use my right hand to press it but the right side of the space bar is not responsive enough. Unless if i hit it harder.Its ok. buttons might "Easy" into it eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this is January. 10 months and the function key popped off. I dont use the function key since it doesnt serve any use. This is my work keyboard and I used it 36 to 48 hours a week. The space bar is intermittently not registering my key stroke. For 70 dollars I thought it would last a bit longer. Otherwise this keyboard is great and received a lot of compliments. Even switched a gaming keyboard user to it after driving every employee crazy when working with him.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Things just aren't made like they used to be...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in June 2019 and I must report that one of the keys has popped off and no amount of fussing has allowed me to reattach it. I type a LOT (I work in a call center as a supervisor and I type out 50-100 emails a day) so I can say for a less rigorous typer this keyboard will last twice if not three times as long. It's disappointing that a keyboard of this price point didn't survive longer. But. What can I say. Things aren't made like they used to be!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great illuminated keyboard, until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was the second one i purchased (Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me!) Some of the key tops popped off of the first one, which I thought was odd, but I went ahead and re-ordered the keyboard, since I like it. I had the second one for about 9 months, and a numerical key popped off. I don't know how to fix it. It appears that the seller refers back to Amazon for returns, Amazon won't accept after 30 days, and Logitech won't deal with issues if you bought from a seller other than them. So, apparently I'm out of luck? So, very disappointed in the product quality, although initially if seemed very good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for sore wrists and fingers. Light touch keys, responsive
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a comfortable keyboard for months. I have a bit of carpal tunnel in both of my wrists after typing etc for 40 years. Most ergonomic keyboards are strangely configured and would take a while to train my brain to type differently. This one provides relief with effort, not too much, not too little, just right Didn't need the illumination but it's nice, don't use for gaming so can't speak for that use.
customer_reviews.author: daschultz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard, tactile but almost silent
customer_reviews.text: I've been hunting for a good keyboard that was silent, backlit and low-profile, and this thing is absolutely excellent. My friends can't hear me typing when I'm in a call, the keys have a nice, punchy tactile feel, and the backlight is nice and bright. The only thing I don't like about it is that the F1-F12 keys as well as Print Screen and Pause/Break have their function icon backlit instead of the actual button name. It's so good, though, I'm giving it 5 stars anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jaitsu

customer_reviews.title: Great feel
customer_reviews.text: I've used laptop keyboard exclusively for last 10+ years. Recently switched to a Desktop computer and keyboard has been a struggle until I found this one. The keys have a lighter feel like a laptop even though the keys themselves are a lot more sculpted. The keyboard is also very flat like a laptop which I preferred. Having the soft palm rest is also nice. I mainly am using it with a Linux OS and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Phippard

customer_reviews.title: Hand rest coating became sticky and gooey after several years
customer_reviews.text: After several years of using this product, the coating on the hand rest became sticky and gooey. I initially thought I must have had dirty hands. so wiped off the surface, but the stickiness continually got worse. I noticed that another reviewer also commented on this problem. I found it intolerable, so I replaced the keyboard with the same product. I know that sounds incredibly stupid, but I otherwise found this keyboard to be superior to any other I have used, and if it takes a few years for it to get sticky again, the yearly cost is not horrible. Logitech should correct this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Wary

customer_reviews.title: been using this keyboard for a decade
customer_reviews.text: I was browsing Amazon and came to find out that I bought this keyboard more than 10 years ago. I'm still using it, and it's still going strong. It's great to type on, the keys have nice travel and feedback. It's quiet. The backlighting has never failed and the keys have never worn to show too much backlight. A couple of keys have come off over the years but they can be put back on, though it does take some effort, you can't just pop them back on. Overall this is the best keyboard I've ever owned in my life.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but I am wary about longevity. Function Keys are for Windows Vista, not Windows 10.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second K740. The first one died for seemingly no reason, after about 6 years, then I used my old PS2 KB from the 90s since 2015. Well After 4 years of old school, I was ready for backlight again. I really liked the k740 when it worked, so I got this second one. So far so good. I hope it lasts longer than the first one, because $60 is a lot of drop on a keyboard. Which is better than the $100 they originally sold for, but still pretty pricey. Things I don't like about it. The function hotkeys are made for windows Vista and are useless in windows 10. There is no sleep hotkey
customer_reviews.author: H Jay

customer_reviews.title: My third one!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. The tactile feel is good for me. They last for a couple of years even though I'm pretty rough on them when I'm gaming. I like the fact that they are lit, so I can find the keys at night when shut the lights off in my room. The profile is compact so it doesn't take up a ton of room on my desk and I like it that is low and not clunky. They probably don't last as long as some of the larger, heavy duty keyboards but... for my money, I enjoy the elegance and light touch. Also... the keyboard clicks are quiet. Well done Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: Luv Am A Zon

customer_reviews.title: 2 years later, keys breaking
customer_reviews.text: I loved this keyboard for a while. The keys are quiet, the angle is good for me, and the backlight feature is nice. However, there is a white, plastic square frame under each key that the top of the key fits into. After less than 2 years of use, 4 of these are broken. One actually broke right after I got the keyboard. The top of these keys sit unevenly now and don't get pressed at the right angle. Now I have to start over with another keyboard. I would not recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty quiet; nice backlit keys; feel seems ok
customer_reviews.text: My use of voice dictation was limited, because random one syllable words like "him" would be typed from extraneous noises. I finally figured out that the keyboard was the primary culprit. So I replaced it with this Logitech, and it appears the voice dictation problem has been virtually eliminated. The keyboard's backlighting is also very nice. The keyboard does have a functional palm rest, and I feel like I am rapidly getting use to the feel of this keyboard. I recommend this keyboard for those needing low noise typing.
customer_reviews.author: Rod of SATX

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard except for one thing...
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this keyboard except for one thing: the raised piece on the f and j are almost non-existent, so my fingers are constantly lined up incorrectly and pressing the wrong keys. I never look while I type but now I constantly have to look at the keyboard. I love the feel of the keys and the backlighting, however, so it’s a keeper! UPDATE One year later... The 'e' key has broken and cannot be fixed. It's only one year old and nothing has happened to this keyboard to break that key. Very disappointing. Between that and the lack of markers on the f and j keys, I won't be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Cobra

customer_reviews.title: It's great ergo keyborad; but it's no macro support
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has been used for about 6 months. So far so good. One thing I really hope is that Logitech can provide the same feature on writing macros like Microsoft ergo keyboard 4000. I have used it for a long time with many macros. It saves me a lot of keystrokes daily. But this Logitech keyboard key is very comfortable and response time is very good. Unfortunately, it doesn't have the same macro support to let me customize my commonly used keystrokes into my macros. I hope Logitech can develop the new keyboard software apps to support this in their entire product line not just for the gaming keyboards. I believe many working people will love to see this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Illuminated and Silence Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: You can control who bright it is or turn it off, the actual letters are illuminated so it wont bother your eyes. If you hit it hard you will hear the key strokes but if you just touch it it is silence. I never miss a stroke, includes speak off and on keys which for me is a plus plus other extra function keys. It is a wired keyboard which in my case is what I wanted it. The best keyboard I ever had. I am a light keyboard user, I use it to type documents and for my photography programs, in my case it is been working without issues since I purchased it 4 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: REDBOX MASTER

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard.  Very quiet!
customer_reviews.text: There is no ZZZzzz or Sleep shortcut button: you'll have to use Win/D/U, etc. But it's good to learn a few Windows shortcuts anyway. Backlight works fine and has three brightness settings plus off. The palm rest is noce, but could use a little padding IMO. The keys are very smooth and quiet! I have noticed the locator bumps on the F and J keys are very slight on mine, especially the J. I've considered putting a drop of epoxy or something on it to make it easier to feel but I hate to mess up the sleek feel....
customer_reviews.author: Robert Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: I guess I'm picky but this is my second one!
customer_reviews.text: For me this is the best keyboard I have ever had! I liked it so much I ordered another one when the old one started to fail after 5 years (I think). I like the tactile feel of the keys and the lights and other features as well. Only gripe is that to replace the individual keys it's very expensive and a delicate operation (I broke a replacement S key almost immediately, that's how delicate the plastic is). That may be all my fault but just be aware that if you drop something heavy as I did...on keyboard or blast too hard with canned air on it and need to replace something it's no picnic.
customer_reviews.author: Halfway smart most of the time.

customer_reviews.title: This is the most comfortable keyboard for the purposes of writing I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: When I wrote this review the first thing I did was do a keyword search in the reviews for the word, "comfortable." The word appears in 310 reviews, and this review will make 311. There is good reason for this. It is VERY comfortable. If you are a serious writer looking for a keyboard you can type on for hour after hour, this is it. Could it be more attractive, sure. Could the light be brighter, sure. However, in my personal opinion, if that ability to type, be it a novel or a dissertation, is the purpose of a keyboard this lives up to that goal!
customer_reviews.author: R Wixel

customer_reviews.title: Only one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. I have purchased several for myself and as gifts. Everyone likes it. Only one flaw; it is a bit fragile. I accidentally dropped my cell phone (a distance of about two feet) on the keyboard. A keypad came off as well as two tiny plastic parts that cross each other underneath the pad. A tiny part on the keypad was broken. It is impossible to fix and spare parts are unavailable. Imagine how one broken key can slow you down. Lost another one when the cat landed on it. Clumbsy cat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOUCH & ILLMINATION
customer_reviews.text: This is my second KT740 in 6 years. The keys are well lit and letters clear and good size. The key touch is perfect for me. I have tried other cheaper lighted keyboards but they don't come close to the quality of the KT740 and I returned them. Spend the extra bucks and get the best that will last you many years. Also, this is the only lighted keyboard I found that turns the illumination off when you put the PC into sleep. The others stay lighted. G
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lighted keyboard is great for my home computer
customer_reviews.text: My wireless keyboard died and this time I bought an extension for the cord so I could use a keyboard that I believed would be more reliable, especially because I wanted one that is lighted. I love the keyboard back-lighting feature. For my particular desk with it's black surface surrounded by a slightly-raised wood trim, the 3.5" of "palm" rest means that I have to move closer to the desk than I had to with the last keyboard. So ergonomically it's not as comfortable for me as the last one had been. I should have noticed that and looked for one without those added inches.
customer_reviews.author: sunny

customer_reviews.title: No Batteries Required
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, all is well so far. Just writing this because the product info is incorrect. 3 places on this page it references batteries. Are they required, "yes" it says in 2 places. Are they included, "no" is says implying that they are needed. This is a wired keyboard, there are no batteries needed!
customer_reviews.author: rmac

customer_reviews.title: Keys broke after just 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet and illumination is perfect. This is my third K740. The first one was fulfilled by Amazon and lasted 8 years. The second also fulfilled by Amazon is still being used after 4 years. The third one is not fulfilled by Amazon and the keys broke after just two months. I'm hoping it was just a fluke so I ordered a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy 2xs

customer_reviews.title: Failed right after the Amazon refund deadline
customer_reviews.text: This could have been a great item, but it quit working properly shortly after the deadline had passed to return for a refund. Very, very disappointed. Illumination wouldn't work properly, space bar was doing weird things, and some of the alphabetic keys were typing extra weird characters (like apostrophes).
customer_reviews.author: arcticmom

customer_reviews.title: STARTED TO FLICKER/ Now OK
customer_reviews.text: The backlit keys began to flicker and key function ceased. Discovered that if I re-plugged the USB it would work until the next time. Can't trust it if I need it to input a password. Too bad, I had a K800 that lasted for years. Followup: The K740 is now on my good list. Although this item is "plug and play" it did not work well with resident drivers. After I downloaded the Logitech driver the key board had full function.
customer_reviews.author: mtree

customer_reviews.title: What's happening to Logitech? Flimsy, quick to fail, look-alikes for a once fine keyboard
customer_reviews.text: After hardly any use the letter A now sits akimbo with some complicated odd glue joint visible under it. I’ve used the original beautifully functional keyboards for many years. While a windows user it was great that the original keyboards felt like they were Apple quality hardware. These new look-alikes feel like they are world-market stuff at trust-me prices. Looking at the recent low K740 keyboard reviews one hardly needs add another to the slew of similar complaints. I’ll be more wary of buying Logitech-anything in the future.
customer_reviews.author: OldEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Within a Month, Three Broken Keys
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought this keyboard for a Windows edit station. It does not get daily use... probably up to 3 days a week someone will work at this station, so not heavy use. Yet within about three weeks of us installing this we had three or more broken keys. Amazon's warranty on this is only for a month -- so buyer beware. We asked for an exception, which we received since we attempted a refund only 5 weeks after purchase. Given how poorly it performed -- and the overall hassle of a return -- I would not recommend this keyboard. I'm on Amazon shopping for a new one from a different manufacturer now.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient feature
customer_reviews.text: My computer and keyboard are in a corner cabinet that is relatively dark. Having a lighted keyboard really helps a lot. The lighting is adjustable in brightness, but I keep it on the brightest setting. I use my computer for home finances, email, news, information, and gaming. The keyboard does not have a Scroll Lock, but I never used that feature anyway. It does have the normal Caps Lock and Num Lock. A nice feature it has is that you can control your computer speakers from the keyboard, mute and volume. I use that feature frequently, especially while gaming or for annoying commercials.
customer_reviews.author: T. Spiggle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful keyboard... as long as you don't really use it.  Will never buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: The feel is awesome, the size is perfect. Love the backlight. That being said, this keyboard is too delicate. It can't handle water at all. The keys break too easily. Any serious gamer will destroy it quickly. I've bought two now and both have serious issues, an I don't even game anymore. Both have key that don't work or are cross linked. My d key has come off and the delicate little tabs that hold it on have broken. When I hit the spacebar, my sound toggles the mute. On my other keyboard Escape key is dead and the caps lock key jams. I'm going to have to buy a new keyboard and I won't be buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Preferred to DAS 4
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a DAS 4, tried them both, and kept the Logitech. The DAS was actually nice, but had longer key travel and was very "clacky". If my preferences were different, I could imagine keeping the DAS. I am an attorney and type my own documents, so I appreciate a good keyboard. I am not in to gaming. Over time, I have gotten used to the lower key travel of Logitech and Apple style keyboards. For my hands, the Logitech was preferable. Some reviews say the Logitech will not last, and after 3 days, I can't say either way. But if this keyboard holds up for any length of time, I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Corenfa

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tactile feedback. Very quiet and very comfortable to use. The back-lighting is a nice feature as is the comfortable wrist rest. The only improvement I see would be to have the wrist rest a bit more resistant to dust. But I would not want that to be achieved by making it in any way less comfortable. I ran into none of the problems reported elsewhere in this thread. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Skip this and try something else.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what is going on with Logitech these days, but the quality has gone way downhill. Within a week a key popped off and I can't get it seated again. The keyboard is useless and is now in the junk pile along with the mice I've has to toss. I went back to my corsair mechanical which doesn't feel as nice, but at least the keys stay on. Update: I tried to put the key back on and it's staying halfway on, halfway off, but another key has now popped. Sixty freaking dollars and this is the garbage that Logitech is passing out?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but didn't last long and a replacement never arrived from Logitech
customer_reviews.text: While the keyboard's illumination feature is great, our keys got stuck and rendered it unable to function after about 5 months. I tried to return it to Logitech. It took a very long time to communicate the problems and needs (I also had a corded mouse that broke) and ultimately never received the replacement keyboard. It was very frustrating. The problem was not with Amazon, but with Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Busy BeeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: 5 year life span?
customer_reviews.text: How long is a keyboard supposed to last? About 5 years, I guess. I've posted a photo showing the keys (C, D, K, L, and SHIFT) becoming chipped and partly to completely illegible. Additionally, the right shift key no longer reliably shifts to capitals anymore. The keyboard resides on an under-desk sliding keyboard tray so there's been no unusual abuse. I don't think I'm any more of an aggressive typist than anyone else. Logitech typically makes good products but I'm looking around for a different manufacturer to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: J White

customer_reviews.title: Cheap build quality
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased/owned a ton of Logitech products, but I'm really disappointed with the overall build quality of this unit. The plastic is cheap and the edges are kind of sharp. However, the biggest annoyance is that some of the keys are so close to the keyboard housing that they scrape or get stuck when you try to push it down. For example, the "CTRL" button on the bottom left hand corner is hard to press because the key rubs against the keyboard frame. Really bummed because I just bought a Logitech MX Master and the build quality on that was fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Cousin Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Materials dont hold up otherwise the best keyboard on the market - please FIX
customer_reviews.text: This is my second keyboard. Love the backlight, soft keys, layout and everything else you can think of. EXCEPT one thing. The keys break from regular use. I cannot buy a 3rd after normal usage , they keys pop out and the hinge that keeps the keys connected gets stripped. Its the second time in a couple years. At this price, better materials need to be used. I love this keyboard, but a year into it, I have to superglue keys back and then they are off-kilter and hit other keys, I spend a lot of time backspacing and fixing typos because my 'y' key now hits my 't' key because it broke. Ma
customer_reviews.author: Adam Winger

customer_reviews.title: GREAT KEYBOARDS -- BOTH NEWEST AND PRIOR VERSIONS !!!
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard for full size keys, comfortable use and accurate typing (even for someone like me with misbehaving fat fingers). I can not speak about supposed quick wear-off of letters/numbers on keys, or pop-off key caps yet. However I can say that I enjoyed the use of the K740's predecessor for many, many years and had no such problems. I suspect people who had such wear problems probably had too heavy a hand or typed massive volumes of information on a keyboard designed for ''average'' home level usage at the price charged. (I'll try to update this report should anything notable occur within the next 6 to 12 months.)
customer_reviews.author: eNGeeNC

customer_reviews.title: This is nowhere near as good as the exact same version I bought years ago.
customer_reviews.text: It looks identical. It is the same model. But two extremely important aspects have dramatically declined since I first purchased this model keyboard. First, this used to be almost silent, but now you hear every click and clack. Second, it used to be fast - I could type as quickly as my fingers would move, but these keys do not bounce back as fast as the older version. Don't you have to mention somewhere that this is not really the same keyboard? I've been such a fan of this keyboard that I've bought it for friends, and for staff. But this product is now just below average and yet still almost the exact same premium price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Roberts

customer_reviews.title: When the keys come off they are impossible to get back on.
customer_reviews.text: I used to love these keyboard. But the "HOME" key just broke on mine and I cannot for the life of me get it to snap back into place. This keyboard is not like other keyboards where they make that job easy. I have bought 6 of these over the years and even recommended them to many of my peers in software development which has served to sell a dozen more of them at least. I will not be doing that anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Even with repeat issues, still my preferred keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: So, I've had this keyboard for a few years now. I ordered my first one in 2015, and it stopped working (several dead keys) in Nov. 2016, so I ordered another one. That keyboard just recently 'lost' its "K" key and the key will not stay back on in spite of repeat re-attachment. However, it's a comfortable, quiet keyboard, which is what I need - I use it for work as well as gaming, so it's basically being used 8-15 hours per day, every single day. I've reordered it, again, this time with the 2-year protection plan... because I'm a little tired of repurchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: delivery box was stomped on! or sat on by an elephant! even shows that in their own delivery photo!
customer_reviews.text: i have no idea how this product works yet. Will let you know later. I have to dig it out of the crushed box first!!!!! .. well the keyboard survived the delivery people's horrid handling. with nothing inside the box to protect it too. What a keyboard. it works and that is lucky for all! so far, so good. this had better last four years plus or I will get a NEW one.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard - but does not last
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is really good and I loved it. but it just doesn't last. The keys pop off after a few months use. Between my wife and myself, we've ordered four of these. When the first two broke, we convinced ourselves it was a fluke and ordered the same model as replacements. We really wanted these keyboards to work. Sadly, they just do not work for the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Jamon

customer_reviews.title: Love the K740 but not this broken one......
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard and Amazon and order 3-5 times a week. I have the keyboard at my home office and decided to buy one for my business office. Not happy with this one and gave it 2 stars because the R key is broken. I just plugged it in today and within a couple hours the R key is popping off. Now I will need to try and fix (glue) the keyboard I just plugged in. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: blackngold4evr

customer_reviews.title: but it turned out fine. I like that you can change the lighting ...
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the shipping packaging, but it turned out fine. I like that you can change the lighting feature and the keys are so smooth and easy to type on. I like the feeling of typing on this keyboard. For me it was worth the extra expense. I take away one star for lacking a button for putting the computer to sleep. The software I downloaded doesn't seem to allow you to assign any of the keys for making the computer go to sleep. That is the one thing I like about the junk keyboard that I got with the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J Beckett

customer_reviews.title: Space Bar gave out after 4 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for 5 years and it worked great until all the numbers wore off - so I got this one to replace it - it only lasted 4 months - the space bar stopped working - I took it apart and cleaned it but it did no good. For the price I paid I would expect higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly for 6 years of light use. It feels like typing on a keyboard, which I think I like. Kids spilled a little water on it and now it has several keys that don’t work correctly. All of this is to say that it is not water resistant, which I’m not even sure if it’s advertised as such. If I would have known about the spill I could have banged out the water while upside down and attempt to do a better job to salvage it, but I was not awarded that opportunity. Knocking a star off for seemingly poor water resistance, buying another one as I am a creature of habit.
customer_reviews.author: reako

customer_reviews.title: Quiet,with Low Action and Well Lit.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 'lower action' keyboard.This Logitech keyboard is lower action,less distance the key goes down so fingers don't get stuck.This Logitech keyboard is also quiet,not clunky or typing sound,The back lighting is perfect (adjustable) for me since I work in subdued light to reduce glare.I use the Logitech keyboard for customer service work,where I need a keyboard that does all of the above mentioned things,and this one works very well for me.
customer_reviews.author: jjjohn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this keyboard. I purchased another for my home office set up. I’ve been using this keyboard since about 2018, and it still works great. What I love about it is that it is very quiet, and the keys are soft and not difficult to press down. To provide context, I use my keyboard 5 days per week (8+ hours per day) and type and use the 10-key. The feature that i love is that it is backlit - you can also reduce or turnoff the lights if you wish to do so.
customer_reviews.author: GE

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard as my old one was on it's last legs. I wanted n illuminated keyboard with soft touch keys. I love this keyboard so far. It is nice,easy to use and when the computer goes to sleep, the illumination goes off. There is also a button on the board that allows you to dim the lighting, even to be able to have no illumination.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall King

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like the heavy fingers needed
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me. The shift and ctrl keys never worked right. Space bar could be picky too. You have to hold them down hard and several typos and missed passwords along with way. I gave it 2 months to break-in, thinking it would loosen up. No such luck. On Saturday, I purchased another Logitech K800 (have one at home, this is for the office). Out of box, it works like it should. What a relief! I went with the wired K740, because I thought having a cap lock and num lock that light up when on/off would be nice. The wireless keyboard can't do that. I'm now happy to go without those key indicators.
customer_reviews.author: seattlegirl

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this keyboard, feels great
customer_reviews.text: Been typing on a laptop keyboard for a few years. Decided to dock the laptop and leave it closed and use external monitors and keyboard/mouse. Had a few keyboards laying around but they were too loud or didn't feel right. This keyboard feels GREAT! It's super quiet, the keys feel nice to press, they go down easy, and the layout is similar to what i'm used to. Love the backlit keys for those middle of the night calls.
customer_reviews.author: chouse

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my second of these over the span of many years. I like the key feel and the tap volume isn't too high. I like the illumination. Most importantly, no issues after 5 years with the old one while I'm on mouse number 5 and my laptop keyboard itself is largely dead. I'm a programmer, so I'm on it all the time every day.
customer_reviews.author: IBrown

customer_reviews.title: Sneaky and ninja backlit-elegant keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: After my last one was submerged in coffee, I was so excited to receive another one, and was not disappointed. The illumination this keyboard offers with the tactileness of the keys makes for an ergonomic and productive experience. Truly a plug and play device. Rather than the price being a barrier make sure to get your employer to pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A MUST BUY FOR ANYONE. So sleek, smooth, well positioned large keys for perfect typing and comfort. I am on the computer all the time running business out of home. Wish I would have treated myself to this a LONG time ago. It is a dream cloud of typing. And LOVE the illuminated keys...yes we have a desk lamp but with my old age eyes it allows for my quicker response being able to see the keys when typing at night (there are nights I am working til very late).
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Marek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, versatile.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older version of this keyboard I've had for a few years. My girlfriend decided she wanted one because she likes the heft, soft key feel and backlight on mine so she's getting this one. I cannot recall being disappointed with any Logitech keyboard or mouse purchases I've made in the past five years and I've made several. If you bother with the kit software, it's intuitive and simple. If you don't bother with the kit software, the keyboard works fine anyway. It's a good purchase for most all applications. I'm also an avid PC game enthusiast and recommend this keyboard as a less expensive alternative to gaming gear
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for quite awhile and the "D" key recently started being pesky. I have loved the quiet smoothness of this keyboard and love the illumination and so I decided to reorder from Amazon. Since I purchased the first one here, I simply went to my Orders and searched. Lo and behold it was 5 years ago! Granted, it's about $12 more now than it was then, but I am an IT professional who has been working from home for over 5 years. That thing is my daily companion. I loved it then, I love it now.
customer_reviews.author: Bill MacArthur

customer_reviews.title: Fingertips can get stuck under the keys. Not a great design.
customer_reviews.text: The keys have a slim profile but a standard travel. So, for example, when you press the letter "N", the underneath of the adjacent key "J" is exposed. So your fingertip could very easily catch the underside the "J" key when pressing the "N" key. This causes the "J" key to flip upwards. Otherwise a very nice keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Warning!
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech K-74 keyboard is a great keyboard but if a key falls off, you will need to get a new keyboard. The keys are attached by a flimsy piece of plastic and are not repairable. After much time I found the correct person at Logitech and consider my issue as 100% solved.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Walding

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, quiet as a mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great. I bought it to duplicate my work setup, at home. I can have my mic within inches of the keyboard and people on my conference calls cannot hear me typing during the call. It's nicely back-lit, with 3 levels, plus "off". Key stroke has a good feeling and registers regardless of whether I strike the center or edge of the key.
customer_reviews.author: Akita

customer_reviews.title: I have bad arthritis and tendonitis in both hands/arms and I've tried ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bad arthritis and tendonitis in both hands/arms and I've tried a billion different keyboards over the years, but this manages to be the best I've ever used. I just keep coming back to it. With heavy duty use, you'll see the letters on the older models rub off eventually, and my blunt nails actually ended up putting grooves in my old version of this keyboard (again, very heavy use), but there's no keyboard like it. I used my last one for at least eight years. I hope my new one lasts that long...and so far, so good. I haven't seen the letters even smudge yet. So that looks promising!
customer_reviews.author: Manna

customer_reviews.title: Works well...nice keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these before and I liked the touch and feel of the keyboard. I plugged this into my PC and it updated drivers and starting working almost immediately. Key click is not whisper quite but much better than most keyboards so I can type without interrupting conference calls with my "key clicks". I take notes electronically and not with pen/paper, so this is important. Overall I am happy with the keyboard and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: soundsorcerer

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity at it's finest!
customer_reviews.text: I simply just love it! If you're looking for a simple keyboard that is quiet yet sturdy and has backlit then look no further.. There is a button on the keyboard to dim the lights or raise its brightness.. Once I took it out of box I could tell my old keyboard that came with CPU which had faded letters on keyboard was holding me back. Didn't know it was loud til I used this one. Also this is a wired USB keyboard incase your wondering
customer_reviews.author: Ytwizz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard for Business and Other Productivity Uses
customer_reviews.text: Much like other high-end back-lit computer keyboards meant for business rather than gaming, but it has an excellent responsive touch and everything is in the right place (except: why can't the caps lock alert light be placed on or near the caps lock key itself, instead of all the way on the other side of the keyboard?). There are 12 useful function key settings for launching browser, calculator, etc. or controlling music/video playback. Want to change the keys backlight from red to green to purple etc. Out of luck; get serious.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Kuch

customer_reviews.title: Keys break easily - did not last
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard worked great for numerous months however within a few weeks the - key fell off on the numeric key pad. Now, the shift button has fallen off and won't go back on at all. I was going to just re order the key board because it is easy to use other than that, but the price is too high to afford another keyboard that will break within 7 months. I bought this keyboard on December 17, 2017 and it isn't functional for me now. Kind of sad to pay $10 a month to pay a keyboard. Is there any manufacturer's warranty or way to replace these keys?
customer_reviews.author: Sandiegobuys

customer_reviews.title: Flexible illumination
customer_reviews.text: This Logitech illuminated keyboard meets my expectations. I can dim the light & when it is fully lit, it is bright enough to be used without the room being lit. I tend to type rather hard because I learned to type on manual typewriters in my youth, but this keyboard takes the "beating" pretty well. I also like the feeling of the keyboard. Besides the feel of the keyboard, the keyboard markings are holding up despite my "hard" typing.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: I've used and loved this Logitech model for as long as I can remember. My old one finally wore out and I went to replace it. Same look and design, but the keys now make the common keyboard loud clicking sound whereas the older versions used to be way quieter and with softer touch. Otherwise it's the same excellent choice for almost all use.
customer_reviews.author: RCL

customer_reviews.title: NOT DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: a button/key broke off when my finger slipped when pressing a diffirect key. not made for gaming not durable enough. Regreted buying it, there are cheaper and better options.
customer_reviews.author: arvin paul perfas

customer_reviews.title: It soft to the touch. It is smooth and it is just wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Logitech K40 keyboard for many years, and before it wears out, I buy a new one. I never buy any other model. It is so soft and smooth. And the keys are roomy allowing for more comfort. I am not sure if it is good for gaming, but I am sure it is good for those who type a lot. I use it with MAC and with my Windows 10, and although it is not advertised as good for either of them, it has works just perfectly with several generations of my computers, even with my 4Ks.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect. But def high performance.
customer_reviews.text: The keys tend to break off. They have cheap plastic tabs. When working I love these keyboards. The touch and response is so great for fast typing. But get two of them. You’ll want to replace keys eventually if your fingers start snapping off the keys. Not real durable. I keep buying them because they work great for a while. I’d call it high maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The quiet keyboard I've been searching for.
customer_reviews.text: After months of searching for a quiet keyboard, I was beginning to give up hope. I decided to try this one after 5 (or so) prior fails with others. I am so glad that I did. This one is very quiet with has low-profile keys that are easy-to-press. It was exactly what I'd been looking for. Oh, and it's back-lit too which is a cool bonus. I often have to do support and maintenance in the middle of the night and needed a keyboard that wouldn't wake the whole house up when I did. Thank you, Logitech. Nice job.
customer_reviews.author: slcwebguy

customer_reviews.title: even though it might look like it's flimsy plastic from pictures
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a quiet keyboard. It's very quiet! It still makes some noise, and there might be a quieter one out there, but this is a solid keyboard and doesn't feel cheap, even though it might look like it's flimsy plastic from pictures. The only thing it's missing is some USB ports on the keyboard itself, but that's just something I like to have and for how thin it is there might not have been room. It is a very flat keyboard, so your hands might rest a little deeper than you're used to, but I didn't mind once I got used to it. Also, it has backlit keys if that's something that matters to you.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Still working after 9 years
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard on and off for 9 years. Originally purchased for a computer I built, now using it at my workplace. My work provided me a thick wireless Logitech keyboard without a num-pad, it felt 'squishy', I have that hidden in a drawer so I can use this nice thin keyboard. It's also quieter than most keyboards I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Sam

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Location markers wore down in a few months. Space bar broke in less than 10 months
customer_reviews.text: The position marker on the f key wore down after about 5 months. The space bar stopped working after about 9 months. For the money, I really expected a lot more from Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very good, but function key labels are obscured
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. I wanted a reliable, non-gaming, non-mechanical, corded backlit keyboard with high contrast. This keyboard ticks all those boxes. The one minor issue is the function key labels (F1-12) are not backlit. These function keys double as FN keys for media control (etc) and their orange media FN control icons are backlit on top of the keys with the "F1" ... F12" labels on the front edge. The F1-12 labels are not backlit and are essentially sit in the shade in low light situations. This is really a minor criticism as these keys are grouped in blocks of 4 so its quite easy to work out which is which. A well deserved 4+ stars
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Benge

customer_reviews.title: Love this Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard back in 2015, and now 5 years later I'm looking to replace it. Between all the food crumbs stuck underneath and missing keys, it's finally time for anew one. I like the way this one feels more than any other keyboard I've used. Logitech makes the best stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Rosinke

customer_reviews.title: So accurate and true illuminated keys.
customer_reviews.text: I had one that was the previous model that just went out on me and I was so disappointed because I loved it. It lasted a little over eight years which is great. Browsing Amazon one night I found an updated version that looked alot like my previous one and bought it. So glad I did because it has the same great features as my previous one. If you are looking for a keyboard that is quiet, responsive, and is great in complete darkness look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Palm rest materials degrade after a couple of years use. Otherwise an excellent keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best backlit flat key style keyboards on the market. The only other keyboard that looks cooler to me is the Moshi Luna sold at the Apple Store. The biggest flaw with this keyboard is that built-in soft touch palm rest. The materials that make up the palm rest start to degrade in a bad tacky sort of way after a couple of years use. I have tossed a couple of these keyboards because of it. I really wish Logitech would make this model with a detachable palm rest or even sell a cheaper version without a palm rest altogether. I much prefer wired keyboards over wireless for my gaming needs so this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: jennjun

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard driver issue makes this keyboard the worst investment in keyboard I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: Every time I boot up the computer The Logitech Illuminated Keyboard would look for a driver and then would install successfully but wants to reboot the computer. When computer reboots, it would look for the driver installation disk again, and then goes through installation and asks for reboot again. What's the deal? There is a flaw here, there shouldn't even be a keyboard driver needed, it should have worked right out of the box without installing more Logitech crap. I am running Windows Server 208R2 32 bit and there shouldn't be any issue. Too late for return so I am stuck with this piece of crap from Logitech. I'll have to think twice about buying Logitech product again.
customer_reviews.author: ExpertSkinDoc

customer_reviews.title: One of the best you can buy for the office.
customer_reviews.text: One of the better office type keyboards. Keys are close together which makes it perfect for smaller hands. Might take getting accustomed to if you have large hands. The keys feel a lot like a laptop. Thinnest keyboard on the market and surprisingly hefty too. Overall very good.
customer_reviews.author: DRen72

customer_reviews.title: 1) Slim keys 2) Backlit 3) QUIET I don't need a loud keyboard that looks like unicorn vomit to wake up my wife while I ...
customer_reviews.text: While most of the PC community goes crazy for the loud and LSD cherry keyboards, I was in the market for something with 3 key features: 1) Slim keys 2) Backlit 3) QUIET I don't need a loud keyboard that looks like unicorn vomit to wake up my wife while I stay up late working. This keyboard was surprisingly quite stealthy compared to my last razer slim keyboard (which was a waste of money). This keyboard is professional looking and beautifully designed. It is very quiet and solid. Logitech is my go-to for PC peripherals and this keyboard is cementing that tradition.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice to type on
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th one of these keyboards I've had. I like them. They are well illuminated with three levels of light intensity and light off. Downside is that eventually the backlight wears out after four or five years and the keys stick because it's hard to clean the keys - I don't know how. I like the programmable function keys. You'll probably like this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: sid mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. The feel of these keys are wonderful due to excellent spacing and the amount of pressure needed for each stroke. Not to mention, the lighting on the keys is quality. I've used other illuminated PC type keyboards and they fail short of displaying the keys at night clearly, but this keyboard demonstrates the perfect amount of light to quickly see where to place your hands and identify each key with just a glance. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for my buck
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is the best one I have ever used in my entire life. It's smooth, sleek, comfortable, and the keys are quiet as I type. For $70 this is 100% worth it. Response time is excellent, and the quality is great. A convinient thing is that it has some volume control keys integrated into the keyboard and it actually works. The backlight is a great aesthetic touch as well. (Just so you know I got this shipped in under a day on Prime. Good on you amazon)
customer_reviews.author: The Englehart's

customer_reviews.title: Nice, clear and functional
customer_reviews.text: Use this for my home computer and the backlit keys are extremely helpful. The layout is simple and there is nothing complicated about the keyboard. The keys themselves respond quickly and efficiently to even a light touch and the built in palm rest is a major plus.
customer_reviews.author: SaxplayernTX

customer_reviews.title: No match for K800
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this keyboard, but it just doesn't cut it. Keys on the left (shift and ctrl) were sticky to press, with loose keycaps. They would get stuck under the bezel. There were also other random loose keycaps that would catch on my fingers when typing fast. I thought it would be the wired equivalent of the K800, but it doesn't nearly match it in quality or feel. K800 is much more solid. I also like the backlight sensing on the K800. On the 740, it's always on. I returned the 740. It's not terrible, but it's not great. If you spend a lot of time at the keyboard, spend extra and get the K800.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Luis

customer_reviews.title: Good for Typing
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Simple white backlight with brightness control - Symbols are still visible without backlighting - No software - Typing feels nice - Quiet Cons: - It only recognizes about 3 keys being held at once (which is only really a problem for gaming) - The F1-F12 symbols don't light up, just the orange functions - It doesn't have a function to put the PC to sleep, which seems like an odd omission Conclusion: I didn't bother comparing it to other keyboards, but this one seems good enough for what it is. You could probably find a cheaper alternative, though.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!! and rather quite keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really love this little keyboard. much quieter than most other separate keyboards I have had. Do i want an even quieter keyboard? Yes. But for this price, this is really good value. I did have a problem with the "0" button the number pad initially, but called customer service and they sent back a replacement keyboard which to date is working really well. So plus for customer service, in addition to keyboard itself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Logitech Illuminated Ultrathin Keyboard K740 with Laser-Etched Backlit Keyboard and Soft-Touch Palm Rest - Black
product_meta.description:
Bright, laser-etched, backlit keys provide precise illumination that can be adjusted to suit your needs. The ultra-thin, 9.3 mm profile adds an elegant touch to any desk. The PerfectStroke key system makes every stroke natural and fluid, and the soft-touch palm rest and full-size key layout help you type more comfortably. System Requirements: Windows Vista Windows XP Windows 7 Windows 8 Windows 10|USB port.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Enlarge

LOGITECH ILLUMINATED KEYBOARD K740
TYPE COMFORTABLY—DAY OR NIGHT.
Experience better typing—even in the dark—with this elegant illuminated keyboard. Each key is back-lit to help you type easily in any lighting conditions. The keyboard also features a soft-touch palm rest, full-size key layout and Logitech PerfectStroke key system to make typing more comfortable, fluid and whisper-quiet.

 PRODUCT HIGHLIGHTS
 *  Laser-etched backlit keys
 * Ultra-thin 9.3 mm (1/3 inch) profile
 * Soft-touch palm rest
 * PerfectStroke key system for comfortable typing
 * Full-size layout
 * Compatible with Windows 8, 7 or Vista

Enlarge BRIGHT BACKLIT KEYS 
 *  Sharp, bright laser-etched keys–type easily in low light and even in the dark
 * Only the key characters are illuminated so they’re always easy to see and read
 * Manual brightness adjustment with three illumination levels to suit any lighting conditions

Enlarge LOGITECH PERFECTSTROKE KEY SYSTEM 
 *  Distributes typing force evenly across the key surfaces
 * Makes every keystroke stroke quiet, natural and smooth—even if you strike the edge of a key 

Enlarge SLEEK AND SLIM DESIGN
 *  Ultra-thin profile is only (1/3 inch) from frame to keys—keeps your workspace clean and uncluttered
 * Elegant look combine classic black, a touch of orange to identify the FN functions and a transparent frame

Enlarge FULL-SIZE LAYOUT
 * Easily navigate your documents—full-size keys and a number pad are right where you expect them to be
   
 * Press the FN key to easily access the most often used functions like search or email
   
 * Separate keys for quick control of volume, mute, back-light intensity and more

Enlarge BUILT-IN SOFT-TOUCH PALM REST
 * Helps position your hands for more comfortable typing
   
 * Soft, rubber coating for enhanced comfort

WINDOWS 8 START KEY
Get back to the Start Screen with one easy touch.

COMPATIBILITY
WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
 *  Logitech Illuminated Keyboard k740
 * User Documentation

WHAT YOU NEED:
 *  Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista or Windows XP
 * 1 available USB port
feature_bullets: Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows XP or Windows Vista, USB port
Laser-etched backlit keys, Manual brightness adjustment
Logitech Perfect Stroke key system, Soft-touch palm rest
Full-size layout. Please note: Product is corded.

USB connectivity - To use the keyboard, simply plug in the USB cable and start typing. The cable is approximately 6 feet long—enough to reach your desktop if it is underneath your desk, or on top of it

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,757 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
